body:
Sadly this doesn't work.
For some reason comments (in mysql) are added via additional alter-commands after table-creation.

I've fixed this problem locally and will create a Pull-Request that work's for me.

issue.title: Fix 17449: Moved Check of column-definition behind Comment when adding a comment to a column

body:
Just stumbled upon extension that sets comment on migration and then Query tries to do it MySQL way. In PostgreSQL the comment is attached later in different statement.

Instead of 
```sql
CREATE TABLE "oauth2_client" (
	"id" serial NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
	"some_column" int8 COMMENT "Some comment"
    ....
)

```

it is
```sql
CREATE TABLE "oauth2_client" (
	"id" serial NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
	"some_column" int8
    ....
)

COMMENT ON COLUMN some_column IS "Some comment";

````
is there a way to disable comments globally in migration?
There is no easy way. Looks like comments for PostgreSQL should be done separately. Could you be able to prepare a PR?

I wish I could do it. DAO and its intertwined components are a beast.
I will try to have a look at it though and see if I can try to fix it.

Do you know where the comments are actually parsed? I tried to quickly find it and I could not!

Right now basic `comment()` is implemented [here](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/db/ColumnSchemaBuilder.php#L202). The trick is to extract that call to a separate SQL statement.

I checked that one but actually it was just assigning it. I wanted to get where it actually processes the comments to create the Query. Am sure there is where I can do something. but could not find. That might be because am unfamiliar on how the whole database access object works under the hood

issue.title: Migration does not work for Postgresql

repository.name: yii2-oauth2-server
repository.description: The Yii2-Oauth2-Server is an extension for Yii framework 2.0 applications and provides an Oauth2 server based on the League OAuth2 server. The server also supports OpenID Connect.
